I don't understand why people get so defensive when the lore is changed. Who even cares? It's not like the league wiki is going anywhere.  You can still read the  old lore any time you want to, and you can still believe in the old lore over the new one anyway. 

I can understand crying about his kit changes, but a title change? I mean, yes, it's a shitty title. Say "hey Riot this title is complete shit" . . . and then go buy the new Jinx skin and watch LCS.

Imagine if you took a character like Ganondorf and made into a clone of Captain Falcon (i know this is a thing or I wouldn't be mentioning it)

this is kinda the issue here
Imagine if the person you said that to had no idea what a Ganondorf is (this is a thing or I wouldn't be mentioning it).

Ok Very Toxic Jinx I'll answer that for you

Ganondorf from the Legend of Zelda series was put in SSB melee

In the Legend of Zelda games he's a badass mage guy who can turn into a fucking pig

And you know what they do, they make him a clone of Captian Falcon a character who's entire moveset has nothing to do with his game (F-Zero a racing game)

So basically they completely removed Ganondorf's identity in SSB

He was a mid teir in Melee with a small yet dicated scene such as Kage the Warrior and Bizzaro Flame (to mention high ranking ones who basically developed his metagame)

In Brawl (the game's sequel) he was completely gutted (given significantly increased framedata which is the speed his moves come out for slightly higher KO power which is often imposible to setup into) and at some points he was considered to be so bad he had a Tier below F, Ganondorf Tier

Ganondorf is so bad that matchup wise its considered to be 17% win chance against Meta-Knight the best character in the game and any intellegent person can just use Meta-Knight Tornado and limit every option Ganondorf has

So the problem that is happening with Mordekaiser is that he has lost all of his identity and is most likely going to become Ganondorf tier after being nerfed to oblivion

And the worst part was is that Nintendo actually had an excuse, Ganondorf was added late in the development process for a game that was made in 13 months (melee), Riot a company who has all the resources in the world is like nope, we need more general characters that can make us money

Edit: So what did the community do?

Project M

The most professional looking mod in the world with almost no source of income (pretty acurate claim) while not making the people who liked his original style in Melee and his theme in Legend of Zelda and put them together

They removed his Warlock Punch (a rip off of the Falcon Punch) into a move that allows Ganondorf to fly connecting with his mage theme more (you'd have to play the games to have that make logical sense but trust me) and actually let him use his sword as a replacement for Warlock Punch into the combo Down Taunt+A giving him one of the most satifying things to ever land in a game.

So while shreking your opponents you actually connect to his lore

And Project M has even more examples of this including Wario, R.O.B.(this is a strech but his character model actually includes markinging of what in acutall R.O.B. would have, R.O.B. is a toy), and Pit who instead of using a general sword attack he can glide across the sky and actually use the sheild he has in his games for his Up B. 

But this is a thing or I wouldn't be mentioning it

B. Help my community which is nearly entirely "grass roots"

And yes I do enjoy playing Ganondorf time to time and yes I normally play top tier characters but that doesn't mean that I can't love the game still

This is what Riot hopes for their game and I seriously suggest that if the community wants something done, to actually do stuff about it if you really care that much (like what the Smash community did for Project M)

I have, so far, not really found someone who made a very compelling argument that wasn't heavily opinionated and/or complaining because it's not the same as it used to be.

Well, I suppose I can try?

I don't think Lord of Death suits Morde for a few reasons. For one, while he enslaves you post-death he's more of an undead theme than true death. Secondly, due to Kindred's existence, and their disapproval of Morde, I don't find Morde having the title "Lord of Death" appropriate since he's at odds with the very primal personification of it. If anything, he's more of a defiler or a heretic.

However, Morde isn't completely metal-based, so "Master of Metal," while nostalgic, *could* be replaced by a better title. Lord of Death, however, is just bland. Personally, if it were up to me, I'd put "Lord of Death Metal" as his title, as both a reference to his dual identities and a reference to old lore and his Pentakill identity. Phreak would probably agree. 

Just my $0.02. I'm not too invested, but I do feel sympathy for the Morde mains who don't like this change and I feel that the new title is quite "meh" to be honest.

^^^ This right here isn't just trying, it's succeeding. ^^^

Rational, and while opinionated, not an opinion born of rose-colored glasses.

Thank you.

Not to mention 'Mordekaiser' = Lord of Death.

Thank you for your valueless contribution.

It's about Mordekaiser. It's about a recent change that is universially considered broken, from the lowest ELO all the way up to the LCS, yet Riot has yet to do anything about it. How is it _not_ related to the conversation?

"It's related to Mordekaiser"

Yes, but half of those threads aren't focusing on the balance of Mordekaiser's rework at all. If this thread were at all focused on discussing his balance, then Lank's comment would be relevant.

It is not relevant to the conversation if you actually read the conversation.

The reason there are so many threads is because the bland-as-fuck name change is taking place *on top of the fact* that Mordekaiser has been completely redefined, gameplay-wise. It's like Riot took a shit, then placed a shit-cherry on top of that shit. People tolerated the shit to some extent, but the shit-cherry crossed the lines of the majority of the League playerbase- even those who have never played Mordekaiser.

You've mis-analyzed that, let me help you with that.

There's the group of the community--mostly Mordekaiser players and people who don't like playing against the new Morde--who have complained ever since the rework hit, and have not stopped.

Then you have the bandwagon, which is the League equivalent of SJWs flipping their shit over every last straw, feather and butterfly within a hundred yards of the camel's back.
---
I understand that there are *completely rational* Mordekaiser threads.

I also understand that **none of the threads** that this thread highlights are rational threads by any stretch, twist or alternate definition of the term "rational."

Catch me in a thread where people are being rational, and you'll find I'm much less of a sarcastic asshole than you think I am.

**Instead of making a bunch of shit threads with 12-year-olds ranting about how they're going to hack Rito for this, why don't we have two or three large, well-composed threads actually creating healthy discussion? Does Riot's mistake permit everyone else to be two steps worse?**

The few threads that give semi-rational arguments may occasionally get a Red post, yes, but most of the time, it's condescending and/or business jargon that goes on for 10 paragraphs but can be summed up with, "Fuck you and fuck your argument. We're doing whatever we want. Thank you for your feedback."

We may be acting like 12-year-olds, but at times like this it feels like Riot is a toddler in the world's biggest sandbox who has absolutely no clue what he's doing.

"They're being childish too, so it's okay."

I *fucking despise* that logic.

K.

Edit: Actually, do you really despise that logic? Because so far, you've been the most aggressive person in this entire thread. Some of your posts could easily get you at least a warning, or even a ban. The rest of us are angry, yes, but we're not going around insulting each other.

actually, the statement "Fuck you and fuck your argument. We're doing whatever we want. Thank you for your feedback." describes very few red posts I've seen.

most red posts I've seen can be summarized by "I want to sympathize but I don't actually have the ability to change anything."

Meddler is different. different tone. different viewpoint. I don't think I understand Meddler.

At this point it just doesn't matter. We see the reaction to the slow changes to character/game play of Morde and are powerless to do anything. You see the reactions to Kathykhaos, the boards favourite Red. Or the -272 points on Ant In Oz's post [here](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/cKv5fAvE-rest-in-peace-mordekaiser?comment=0005). 

They don't care. It's their goal to move Morde from what he was, into what he will be. With little (at best) to no regard to the players. This started with CertaintyT's complete change of game play, and is followed up with the new character theme. It's Trundle all over again. However this time they tried it in stages to see if anyone would notice.
**"OUR FORUM COMMUNITY DOESN'T REPRESENT OUR COMMUNITY, WE'RE TRYING SOMETHING DIFFERENT GUYS!!!!!!!!"**
hate to break it to you but 60 upvotes on the boards is not indicative of what the entire community as a whole thinks
Yet it was enough for such things as fiora changes, riven changes. How does this work then exactly?

New depths of retardation have been reached by Ant in Oz.  With a single post, he's shown just how oblivious the people in charge of making reworks are to what a champion actually is. 

Mordekaiser means - The (lord, king, emperor) of (killing, murder, death).  To name him, Mordekaiser - The Lord of Death would translate to "The (lord, king, emperor) of (killing, murder, death) - The Lord of Death."
Death Lord - The Lord of Death
